content.question: Which of the following explains how Congress would most likely respond if it were concerned about the slight increase in spending over time, as indicated by the bar chart?

choices.label: Congress could vote to remove the secretary of Homeland Security.
Congress could hold a special joint session to discuss potential solutions.
Congress could vote to reduce spending on the Department of Homeland Security in the next year’s budget.
Congress could pass a constitutional amendment limiting appropriations.

content.answer: Congress could vote to reduce spending on the Department of Homeland Security in the next year’s budget.
